wikipedia_page.main: John Pairman (1788–1843) was a Scottish portrait and landscape painter operational in the 19th century. His style is derivative of his contemporary, David Wilkie.

response: *John Pairman (1788–1843), artist - lived in Biggar and is buried in the parish churchyard.
Tinto Hill was painted by John Pairman in 1841.
Symington was painted by John Pairman of Biggar around 1830.Art UK
